unittitle_ssm: E. M. Davis papers from Francis H. Leggett & Company
abstract_ssm:
Seven items associated with the New York City importers and distributors of food products, Francis H. Leggett & Company, related to grocer E. M. Davis of Goldsboro, North Carolina: Two letters (with envelopes) from 1913, one from Leggett employee C.A. Hamner introducing Davis to Leggett president John C. Juhring, and one to Davis from Juhring inviting him to visit the company's offices in New York City; Juhring's business card; a Leggett business card for H.W. Johnson (1938 is written on the card); and a label for Honeymoon English style toffee, distributed by Leggett. 

To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: E. M. Davis papers from Francis H. Leggett & Company
